title: Calories in 2 Strips of Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 strips bacon, including fat, protein, sodium, full nutrition breakdown per strip, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard pork bacon strips, pan-fried until crisp, drained of excess fat; each strip ~8 g cooked weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut thickness, cooking method, and fat drainage. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two strips of cooked bacon provide ~86 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Oven-baked with less oil drainage (per strip)

faqs.q: How many calories in one strip of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal per cooked pork bacon strip.

faqs.q: What is the fat content in 2 strips bacon?
faqs.a: Roughly 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes—pan-frying and draining reduces fat/calories vs. microwaving or less drainage.

faqs.q: How much sodium in 2 strips of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 384 mg, which is notable for low-sodium diets.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in bacon strips?
faqs.a: Very few—about 0.2 g total for 2 strips, mostly 0 g fiber or sugars.
